column2: Global Reporting Initiative+Direct greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions (Scope 1), GRI 305-1-a (formerly G4-EN15-a)
column10: To calculate the total direct GHG emissions, we have taken all the direct GHG emissions. As it is not mentioned clearly whether nitrous oxide is direct or indirect, we have not considered and furthermore, we have to convert tonnes to tonnes CO2 equivalent as well. (Conversion rate : GWP is 28 for methane; GWP is 1 for CO2) (Conversion : 11614 kt x 28 = 325,192 kt CO2 eq ; 56972 kt x 1 = 56972 kt CO2 eq) (Calculation : (Direct methane + Direct CO2) = (325,192+56972) = 382,164 kt CO2 eq) pg. 45 "Greenhouse gases (GHG) (kt) Direct methane (CH4) (2021) 116,14 Direct carbon dioxide (CO2) Scope 1 56,972 " Manali Rana[https://wikirate.org/Manali_Rana].....2022-05-31 12:25:26 UTC value of methane is 116.14 So, 116.14 kt x 28 = 3251.92 kt CO2 eq Hence, (3251.92 + 56972 =60,223.92 kt CO2 eq) Manali Rana[https://wikirate.org/Manali_Rana].....2022-05-31 12:54:33 UTC

column10: This figure was found on Sasol's 2020 climate change document, on the 3rd page under "Group scope 1 and 2 emissions for 2020". Ross Nicholson[https://wikirate.org/Ross_Nicholson].....2021-02-04 13:52:56 UTC This information includes Scope 1 & 2 because Sasol have listed their scope 1 and 2 GHG emissions together on one chart. Ross Nicholson[https://wikirate.org/Ross_Nicholson].....2021-02-04 14:03:47 UTC found on pg. 34 Lukas Pilz[https://wikirate.org/Lukas_Pilz].....2021-03-22 13:19:15 UTC slide 34 states 55.6 tonnes for direct CO2 emissions not CO2 equivalents. Using the other GHG information on slide 34, I get: ( 106 kt methane × 25 GWP ) + ( 1.49 kt nitrous oxide × 298 GWP ) + (55 605 kt CO2 × 1 GWP) = 58 699 kilotonnes CO2e (direct methane + direct nitrous oxide + direct co2) joma[https://wikirate.org/joma].....2021-08-26 16:47:39 UTC

Also, direct CO2 should be combined with the other direct GHGs and their GWP to reach Scope 1 CO2e. Changed "56004" to "59119000" ( 106 × 25 ) + ( 1,49 × 298 ) + ( 55605 × 1 ) joma[https://wikirate.org/joma].....2021-08-26 17:01:47 UTC 1 Kiloton = 1000 tonnes (Calculation: 56,004*1000 = 56004000) pg. 73 "Direct carbon dioxide (CO2) Scope 1 - 56 004 " Singh Anjali[https://wikirate.org/Singh_Anjali].....2022-01-24 06:15:20 UTC To calculate the total direct GHG emissions, we have taken all the direct GHG emissions. As it is not mentioned clearly whether nitrous oxide is direct or indirect, we have not considered and furthermore, we have to convert tonnes to tonnes CO2 equivalent as well. (Conversion rate : GWP is 28 for methane; GWP is 1 for CO2) (Conversion : 105.04 kt x 28 = 2,941.12 kt CO2 eq ; 56 004 kt x 1 = 56 004 kt CO2 eq) (Calculation : (Direct ...

column2: Global Reporting Initiative+Indirect greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions (Scope 2), GRI 305-2 (formerly G4-EN16-a)
column10: page 55 table, broken down into two rows, location-based (0.3 million) and market based (2.6 million) = 2.9 million. Boundary is descrived as "Statoil group total indirect GHG emissions" Also has the following note: Statoil's scope 2 greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions include emissions from energy imported from third parties. We use IEA (physical) and RE-DISS < (market-based) as sources for Scope 2 emissions factors. These are expressed as kg CO2/KWh. A location-based calculation method reflects the average emissions intensity of grids (using mostly grid-average emission factor data). A market-based calculation method reflects emissions from electricity that companies have purposefully chosen (or their lack of choice). It derives emission factors from contracts between two parties for the sale and purchase of energy bundled with attributes about the energy generation, or for unbundled attribute claims (Source: Greenhouse gas protocol). Richard Mills[https://wikirate.org/Richard_Mills].....2018-04-09 11:48:35 UTC
